text: The North River Stone Schoolhouse is a historic building located north of Winterset, Iowa, United States. Built in 1874 of coursed native limestone, the one-room schoolhouse educated local students until it closed in 1945. with The building features quoining on the four corners of the exterior, four windows capped with stone lintels on the east and west elevations, and an off- center doorway on the main (south) facade. From 1962 to 1973 the building was restored, and it opened as a school museum operated by the Madison County Historical Society. The building was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1977. ==References== Schoolhouse interior Category:School buildings completed in 1874 Category:One-room schoolhouses in Iowa Category:Vernacular architecture in Iowa Category:Museums in Madison County, Iowa Category:National Register of Historic Places in Madison County, Iowa Category:School buildings on the National Register of Historic Places in Iowa
title: North River Stone Schoolhouse
